I love it and definitely will be top of my list of places to stay when I come to Vegas. Might actually look for this weekend again

Reviews.Author: Chase
Reviews.Content: Awesome night club coming from a local, but the bartender  Angela  completely decimated my experience at the nightclub. She let me know that  I was lucky to get a drink from her I am doing you a favor  she said. Horrible service from this server. She demanded a tip after the poor service. Used to be my favorite local hang out, will never go again. I really wish I could -1 for afterhours

Reviews.Author: Marcela
Reviews.Content: Haters gonna hate.   If you read the reviews you're going to question staying here but do yourself a favor and silence the mental chatter and just book a night anyway.   What you need to know: - This place is basically a swingers hotel with tons of shenanigans happening on weekends, or so the staff told us. We stayed here during the week so there wasn't much of that going on (that we could tell/hear).  - Channel 69 is free and it's not one of those channels that show infomercials on repeat.. - Complimentary valet parking so bring yo dolla dolla bills, yo. - Pool area is small but they have killer lounge beds and it's topless optional (which may be a selling point for you). They close at 7 but as long as you're not making a ruckus, I hear it's not uncommon for them to keep it open a bit later.. it helps if you keep ordering drinks from the bar.  - No ice machines so you'll have to rely on your bartender to hook you up.  - 18+, no kids allowed.   During the week I'd describe this as a dimly lit lounge type of stay (weekends are different). Plus it's a short Lyft ride away to Gold Spike's for some jumbo connect four OR Frankie's Tiki Room (as cute as it sounds). Pro tip: don't miss brunch at The Omelette House (7am-3pm).  Shout out to Jen, the hotel manager! It was nice meeting you!

Reviews.Author: Charissa
Reviews.Content: Barcelona was a great bar.  After hours. Excellent customer service with Renee and Giovanni. Very friendly. The atmosphere is a little weird but is comfortable at the same time.  Great place to just hang out.

Reviews.Author: Danna
Reviews.Content: I agree with a lot of the reviews. there is pros and cons.  I'll just write my experience since all else is mentioned already.  - i find the hotel very pretty and awesome, but also very dark.  - our room, though far away from the after hours nightclub - is right above the pool.  they play music by the pool at all hours of the day, even when there is not a soul out there for hours on end. doesn't make sense to me. its repetitive and annoying. i would prefer quiet - but then again, i would just hear the highway a lot more.  - our room also didn't have an electrical socket by the bed or the desk for the computer. it took me 3 days, but i finally got 2 extension cords.  - the staff is mainly very nice and helpful.  - the pool party was fun, but the music was too loud, with ear plugs. nobody was dancing, so i asked the manager to turn it down a bit, but he said that if more people come, it needs to be this loud so they know its a party. i said that when people are dancing or even standing, its a party. when everyone there (10 people) are laying down - its not a party and i don't  believe i need to go deaf while wearing earplugs. just doesn't make any sense to me. i know i'm older now... 37... but still.  - the club - pretty as everything is here, but also too loud. hurts my ears with ear plugs. also not the music i like to dance to, so essentially i just walked out after less than 5 minutes.  - i don't know if it says this anywhere, but this place is essentially a swingers hotel - so anything goes pretty much anywhere. i have no issues with that, on the contrary, but if you do - stay elsewhere.  - there is not breakfast to be had unless you walk a mile away.  - no coffee / tea - even though they did prepare it for me with a special request.  - restaurant is only open friday and saturday. but if there's an event happening at the bar - then no food for you.  - i think it would be an awesome place for a photo shoots of several kinds.   summary - after you get used to the shortcomings, and the shitty music, its nice and most of all unique. but i have experienced better.   the key is to know what to expect.  Ps - i am again stuck in the lobby right now because the elevator key again will not take me upstairs. 90% of the time that i have attempted to go upstairs in the elevator i needed to go get a new card key that still would not always work. When you are in a rush it could not be more frustrating. They keep apologizing but after 10 times that stopped having any validity.   Its my last morning here before check out.  They were able to extend my morning with a late check out which is always appreciated.

Reviews.Author: Joanna
Reviews.Content: A God-awful place.  I can't add anything new to the bad reviews that have already been posted.  Do yourself a favor and save your money.  You'd be much better off at a Motel 6.

Reviews.Author: Christie
Reviews.Content: Unique kinda goth dark bar? Check Rivals Battista's for art/tchotchke's everywhere you look? Check Dance to some great beats? Check After hours non stop poolside party off Strip? Check Boutique hotel with cool vibe: Check  The Artisan combines some of the coolest dark visual appeal with people watching that is as varied as the above seemingly disjointed list is. And that is a condensed list: add better than average bar food, dining spot which is not too shabby and visually appealing. It is many things to many people and changes throughout the day.   Used to be a go to  let's meet for drinks but not go to a dive/strip  spot. Works like a charm as it is fancier than a neighborhood joint but (relatively) Tool free. Nice mix of locals and visitors.   Had dinner at bar and in restaurant a couple times. AOk. Bar can be slow to serve when busy. I prefer it as a place to party rather than dine.   After hours is a blast. Lots of my friends are musicians and a few years back this was the spot to congregate after their shows on Strip. Now, scene goes all night with pounding beats, high energy and poolside jamming till the sun comes up.   My out of town friends always dig this hidden away gem & one couple even stayed a few nights and noise aside, really enjoyed it. Prices are reasonable for drinks and food, too.   In all, when we want a non corporate glitz night, Artisan is always there. And like the empty picture frames on the ceiling: sometimes you don't know how you ended up there, but it is a good time.   Total fan!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay
Reviews.Content: HATED THIS PLACE! THE DJ wanted to fight bc he didn't want to get off a coat!!! Really I thought DJ were suppose to help the party atmosphere not try to pick fights. All my friend wanted was his coat that the DJ was sitting on and refused to get off of. Then once my bf pushed the dj off of his coat and went outside to leave the dj followed him out to still escalate the situation. Then a security guard came out and instead of trying to break them up took a running start and punched my friend in the face for NOTHING. IT WAS YOUR DJ FOLLOWING OUT CAUSING A PROBLEM AND THAT SECURITY TOOK SECURITY TO A NEW LEVEL. I think that the GM and the head of security who won't give up the name of these people know their wrong and should call me back ITS LINDSAY I know you guys got my 12 messages

Reviews.Author: Frank
Reviews.Content: hhmhmhmhmhhm Labor day weekend in Las Vegas? Long Lines, over priced entrances for guys, and a crazy a$$ time. This place is free, and didn't have a line to get in.   Thanks Artisan After hours! I really enjoyed the smallness of it all, and the music was off the chain Saturday night, well Sunday morning. Guys make sure to wear T shirts, Polo's, or button down shirts, and no shorts. The drinks are pretty expensive, $ 12 for vodka and soda, but that's Vegas. The bartenders are cool, considering everyone's state of mind at 6am. Security is chill, just don't act a fool. This place kept going till 8:30am, and the die hard partiers still kept on dancing, till the end!   Overall I love this place. Its free, no line, and everyone is just there to have a blast. I don't smoke, but the outdoor patio was fun, and was playing the music from inside. Great place to sit when your feet hurt from dancing all night.   Thanks Artisan Afterhours!!!!!!!!You really made my labor day weekend.

Reviews.Author: Alex
Reviews.Content: What an interesting place. I recently stayed here and decided to give it three stars for a few reasons...  First, rating the hotel itself. They make it known from the get go that this is a party hotel. More specifically, it's a swingers paradise. So, as we were informed, the noise level is pretty crazy. Some rooms get the bass from the pool and after hours bar pretty bad. The latter of which stays open until 8 AM on the weekends! We also heard parties and really loud sex coming from tons of the rooms.  If you're reading this you probably already know about the wild decor of this place. It looks like the haunted mansion at Disney with an adult theme. The hallways and rooms also look like they're straight out of a horror movie. The rooms are pretty bad, to be quite honest. The handles were torn off the dresser/nightstand, the tv's volume didn't work, the beds had no blankets (only two sheets) and one of our beds had red stains and pieces of rice in it. Pretty awful. But again, you're probably coming here to party and hookup. So what exactly are you expecting?  The pool was cool and small. It's top-optional as well, not unexpected. We were kicked out for a couples party on a Saturday though, unless we paid to stay. That kind of sucked. I peeked at the party later and it looked like it was getting pretty wild.  The after hours bar is pretty great here. It really doesn't pick up until after 2AM, but then it gets packed and wild. It's actually a lot of fun. However we came down twice over our weekend to try and get some day drinks, but left after about 15 minutes when the bartender was no where to be found.  As I mentioned before, you're coming here for the party, not for world class treatment. Are some of the issues with the rooms unacceptable? Absolutely. But there aren't many places with this sort of scene, so you kind of have to put up with it if you're dead set on having a wild weekend.

Reviews.Author: Hannah
Reviews.Content: I've been here a couple of times when I visit Vegas and I love it. Definitely a great after hours club to go to. Honestly, I've never had a bad experience at this club, everyone is nice and the music is good to dance too. If it gets too hot, there is an outside bar that you can go and socialize in.  I will definitely go back when I am in town again!

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: This is one of my Fav places for an after work drink.  I work right down the street so it's really convenient.  Another big plus is that they make real drinks, not those watered down drinks you get in most of Vegas.  The only downside I'd say is they try to go too clubby on the weekends.  Also the tiny bathroom just doesn not cut it on a busy night! Overall a cool hang out though.

Reviews.Author: Kalen
Reviews.Content: Although the decor is pretty this place is pretty ghetto.   I was shocked at all the good reviews, but realized most of them weren't for the hotel itself.   Our room was dirty with hairs from the previous guest in the sink (it was clogged) and bathtub, the floor had a lot of stains on it, hardly any of the television stations advertised worked alongside the buttons on the phone. When I drove in from LA on a Wednesday morning I was informed there would be parties from 10am-6pm and again at 10pm-6am. Since when do hotels take preference to the low budget crowd vs. hotel guests during weekdays? There was no room in the hotel that could avoid the awful music. Even when the place was empty they were bumping some type of techno.   When I attempted to express my issue with the front desk it was discarded and I was given an  oh well . Extremely bad customer service and room service (Mood). I will never come here again.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: LOUD on weekends doesn't even BEGIN to describe. Being from NYC I understand LOUD.. On the top floor (5th) I though  it cant be that bad ...  Ther speakers from the afterhours club are also OUTSIDE. You really cannot escape the volume. It sounds like you are inside a nightclub trying to sleep. Even the ear plugs I broke down to get at the front desk didn't help much at all.  It's too bad, as this hotel is really artsy and cool. I LOVE the french gothic type decor and the ambiance in the lobby, the rooms are also artist themed and cute.There were minor issues with the room, (drain broken, lamps with missing /non working bulbs) maid service is very minimal.   If you are on a serious budget, it's not the worst, but rethink sleeping on fri, sat and some sundays. I had a serious discount here, so price-wise it was incredibly inexpensive for the week. I was a zombie Sat and Sunday from minimal sleep though ( due to noise level)  Transportation without a car can be trying. Not a bad location, as you are halfway between downtown and the strip for cab rides. Cabs are very expensive in Vegas though, more than NYC!  No food at the hotel, although thy provide delivery menus. I walked to Palace Station for a great breakfast everyday.

Reviews.Author: Betty
Reviews.Content: Headed to the Artisan on Saturday night for post EDC dancing and as usual I was not disappointed. They have the best DJs, both in the lounge as well as in the pool and patio area. Great place for drinks, dancing and admiring outrageous decor. Can't wait to return

Reviews.Author: Samantha
Reviews.Content: Went to the Artisan a little over a month ago for a party. It has an amazing atmosphere. We have lived here all of our lives and have never been to anywhere so cool and unique. The nightlife is so much fun; unlike other Vegas clubs, it has a very relaxed, welcoming atmosphere. Had so much fun that we booked a few rooms for my upcoming birthday at the end of the month. VERY excited!!!

Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: If you read all the other reviews you will see over and over people say how cool this place is, and it is, don't get me wrong. I would give this place 4 stars on my past experiences, but those were lost after last night. Apparently this place is too cool for regular people now and needs a dress code to keep them out. Tried going here with two of my buddies for a few drinks last night. Was turned away at the door. No flip-flops they say.   First they were black leather sandals.   Second why does this not apply to girls, as we walked away we saw a group head over. One had on flip-flops, we said let's see what happens, they all walked right in. Now these girls weren't dressed slutty, and they were not super model attractive. Normal people.   Third I have been here a few times in the past and they didn't have a dress code. It was a really great place for locals to hang out. Very unique lobby / bar / lounge, with all the paintings on walls and ceiling. It just has that I'm cool atmosphere. Seems its so great though they can afford to choose whose money they want and turn people away.    So if you're looking for a place where you gotta dress the part and look cool, head on over. If you want a low key place to just chill and have some drinks and not worry about what you're wearing, go elsewhere!

Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not for the Business traveler.  If you look at the photos they lead you to think this is a cool hotel for any one, it is not.  The Artisan hotel is so far off the beaten path that it is next to impossible to get a cab to go anywhere during the hours of 7AM to 1AM. at 3AM this place is jumping with music and people getting there party on. if afterhours party is what you are in need of this is the place.   The frontdesk staff can only tell you what they can not do for you, if you ask for a receipt showing $0.00 for incidentals, they told me no hotel does that, and they have been in the hotel business for 15 year and I do not know what I am talking about as a traveler.  Not Guest friendly at all they are like Free Range Chickens, they do and say whatever they want, there is no common guest service montra.  Perfect for a club.  I do not say stay away, but I will say,   keep your expectations low.   Party in the front no business in the back.   Valet guys were the most helpful and had the best attitudes of the staff I came in contact with.  Rooms are not so clean my black light revealed human fluids on a variety of surfaces  on the furniture in the room. If that is what your there in the room for you probably do not care about that part.  In conclusion  Business travel NO WAY stay away from the free range chickens at the front desk.   Party Yes Do your Thing! Swing it swinger, Swing. Party on!

Reviews.Author: Roses
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding...For starters, the rooms are affordable. The decor is great! The drinks are not poured lightly! The bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever been on! However... If you intend on getting a wink of sleep, do it elsewhere.   Single pane windows... It sounded like the people outside were next to the bed! There was a huge space under the door which I put pillows in front of, everyone that walked down the hall we could hear. I was also sad our air wasn't working properly.If you enjoy a vibrating hotel that sounds like ugnn ughnn ugnn ughnn non stop from 2-8 am, and like hearing the neghbor above you, well then this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: When you walk in, it has a mystique to it and it's a cool place to go and have a late night drink. The guy at the front desk was rude. The rooms weren't very clean but at least the bedsheets were clean and comfortable. I was turned off by the rude guy at the front desk. I'm a really nice, patient person and it takes a lot for me to get riled up and even then, I wasn't a b-word to this guy. I hope he's not like this to everyone.

Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This was a mistake (Live and learn)  Let's see, where do I start? The desk clerk wanted to charge us for early check-in, which we declined. I was cool with it but began thinking later,  Wait, not a clean, available room at 2:45pm? On a Thursday? Week after Memorial Day?  This actually became an issue once we discovered that the place was a ghost town. It's portrayed as this fun, hip, sensual place but it's actually dark, drab and embarrassingly tacky (I've never saw so many Rubenesque women in my life!) There was no soap in the room, (none), and the teeniest tiniest shampoo I've ever saw lol. Of course we brought our own, but still. I commented to the Mrs that there was no  Do not disturb  sign for the door, but alas, it wasn't necessary. Nobody ever came to the room to clean over the 2 night stay! I guess turnover service must be by request? We did see one  motivated  individual sloooowly pushing a cart through the corridor at like 6pm, so clearly they are understaffed. We had hoped that on Friday night, the  club  would be something to end the night at, but there were only 6, mouth-breathers inside, a couple of whom had suspiciously sexy  girlfriends  with them (wink-wink). Oh, and the  bouncer  was actually holding 2 couples outside for no other reason than for appearances (smh).   Anyway it's Vegas, so we still had a blast (elsewhere) but I'd advise anyone turned on by the price, or Groupon discounts, to just steer clear.

Reviews.Author: Paola
Reviews.Content: Coolest  barteneder, you gotta see him! Dave H, he gave me a warm welcome in my first time at Artisan. Shot of chartreuse (must try) made my night! Will def come back

Reviews.Author: Cayenne
Reviews.Content: This review is for the Artisan Lounge only:  The Artisan is a cool, quirky   lounge  where the decor sells the place.  It's dark, it's lush, and floor to ceiling covered with art reprints (or mirrors, in the case of the ceiling).  Most newbies to the Artisan probably get lost on the approach.  It's in the armpit of Sahara and the 15 (on the SE corner) and takes a couple of sharp right turns to actually get into the place.  Upon first arrival it appears that valet (free) is the only parking option, but if you drive past the  driveway  there is a parking lot down and on the right.  When you walk into the hotel you notice dark, rich colors and the walls are covered with reprints of famous art.  There are cushy chairs arranged around book nooks, which I take advantage of for a refuge from the noise of the club.  I think the loudness of the music is my only real complaint - I think over the last four years that I've been visiting the DJ's have become more mainstream (not necessarily a good thing in my opinion) and the music has become louder - to the point where you have to yell to your friends.  That said, I still go occasionally for the decor and people watching.  The lounge mimics the hotel lobby where there are art prints blanketing the walls and skirt onto the ceiling which they share with framed mirrors.  Friday and Saturdays they have a DJ that plays dance hits mixed with electronica.  If you hit the club early enough you can partake in the couches around the periphery of the club, and I advise checking out their little grotto area, especially if you have a small group.  Drinks ain't cheap, but they're no strip prices either (~$8 for a mixed drink).  I think it's a happy medium for what the place offers.  If you want a break from the strip, but the feel of a club with a more creative and interesting decor, this is the place.  To just enjoy the atmosphere and actually be able to chat with your buddies, avoid Friday and Saturday nights.  I think every Vegas local should check it out at least once, and it's a great example for out-of-town friends to see that Vegas can be more interesting and unique than what is offered on the strip.  I can see this place existing in a town like Portland or Seattle.  side note: I found the restaurant in the hotel completely mediocre, but have only been once.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE IF YOU PLAN ON SLEEPING  What initially drew me to this hotel was the great location (not on the strip), the great decor (which it does have), and the price was right (got it for 89.99 a night on a weekend).   Apparently, I didn't pay enough attention to the reviews online when booking. Yelpers, I'm disappointed in myself for this.   PARKING There is only valet parking. If you want to self parking, it must be done around the corner from the hotel on a side street, and then you have to walk. Lame.   NOISE It was not made clear on the website that this is one of Vega's few after hours clubs. Since the hotel is only 4 stories the noise inside the rooms is DEAFENING. We got no sleep the entire weekend.   So now instead of having a restful weekend in Vegas, we're returning to LA tired and annoyed.

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: The after hours spot! Their resident DJ, Mike Attack is awesome, knows how to keep the party going!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cute and trendy. The entire place is covered with artwork. The lighting is very dim and creepy, which was cool. Its not the typical Vegas style hotel. The club is pretty cool and actually plays some good music. The staff was really cool and friendly.   The only downside is its far away from the strip (about $15). There's no casino or convenient stores in the lobby which might come in handy if you want to buy water. There was no separate room for the shower which made getting ready a little difficult. The a/c shut off every 5 minutes. There were only 2 outlets in the room in the most random places. There was no fridge or microwave.

Reviews.Author: Star
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews...even if your tired. This was not my idea of a good time. It was gothic, creepy, but strangely noisy. We stayed for one night and it was OFF the strip just as it was OFF target for a decent place. Artisan is truly not the word!

Reviews.Author: L.
Reviews.Content: Recently attended a wedding here and stayed two nights. The rooms are in much need of updating and re-doing. Very dark lighting- I guess so maybe you can't see how bad the rooms really are. Gee, where do I begin. The carpet is so old and worn out it is ripped up in some places- UGH. I wore shoes ALWAYS- the carpet looked really dirty!!! You could see where someone had punched holes in the walls- and then maintenance repaired, but not very well. The bathrooms are BAD. No place to hang your towel- or put anything!!! No shelves- No place to put anything!! If you're lucky you get one teeny bar of soap. And maybe a towel. Tub looked dirty and water constantly leaked from the faucet. Ceiling in the bathroom looked like it had some MAJOR repair work done- but was so obvious. Our room had a window looking out onto I 15. Wow- what a view. And constant traffic noise 24/7. Could hardly sleep with the police sirens and loud car and truck noise. Old television- old, worn out and stained furniture- really - a nightmare. Door to our room was obviously tampered with in the past. Holes and marks near the lock- could see out into the hallway the crack between the door and frame was so big. Elevator feels like it will need service sometime very soon as it is so old. Scary. The service in the bar was horrible! Asked for a Mojito- well, they didn't have any limes so had to make my drink with lemon. What? A Mojito with lemon!!!! No way!! And bartender seemed constantly bothered by any requests. Seemed too much trouble to honor any requests for drinks- in fact I heard a person ask for a standard drink called an  old fashion - but couldn't get it because they had no oranges!! Prices for drinks are outrageous. Pool area is also deteriorating. Pillows and cushions all are stained and super old. Bases for sunbathing platforms are all falling apart.  I have a feeling this place is headed for mucho trouble. Hardly anyone else staying in the rooms (that I could tell)- and never anyone in the bar area. Looks like they have closed down the restaurant for lack of any customers.They need to revamp the whole place or it  will not be around much longer. I would never stay here again!! So many places in Vegas to stay that are SO MUCH NICER- NEWER- CLEANER AND FRIENDLIER.

Reviews.Author: Tanya
Reviews.Content: A great find in Las Vegas! I have lived here for a while now and have passed by this place a million times. I would have NEVER gone in myself until I was invited for dinner there.  BY FAR...some of the best food, service and atmosphere I have had in Vegas. Everyone from the valet (all parking is valet only), to the chef was awesome! We stayed for hours drinking wine and listening to 80's music from the bar beside the restaurant. It turned out to be one of those nights out with friends that you will remember forever.  The whole feel of the hotel is very eclectic and artsy. Instantly you are relaxed and intrigued by all the stuff around you. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is great!  Looking for a niche in sin city...this is it! You will love it

Reviews.Author: Karin
Reviews.Content: bou·tique ho·tel noun a small stylish hotel, typically one situated in a fashionable urban location.  REALLY? Being surrounded by strip clubs and adult book stores is a fashionable urban location?  WARNING... Just because it's on GROUPON does NOT make it legitimate! I don't even know what the heck kind of place that was but it was the weirdest place I've ever been in my life!  We paid for 2 nights but only stayed one because the vibes there are so weird and cold!   We actually slept on the floor at our sons house rather than spending another night in that freaky place.  The decor looks like a bordello with naked art everywhere, red lights, and just creepy weirdness.. And the lady who checked us in and out was so unfriendly, she would be better suited to working for a mortician!  No coffee maker, mini fridge, towels and everything are old and ratty.  AND we didn't exec get our free bottle of champagne! Do yourself a favor and STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write bad reviews if the experience is people related. Everyone can have a good or bad experience based on the people. This hotel is horrible though and it had nothing to do with the quality of service.   The hotel itself has a fun idea and I'm sure for just a hang out location is fun. But you don't want to stay here for the night. Really small room,  no fridge, broken ceiling fixture, broken window panes, and nasty carpet. The bed was ok though only two small pillows and two thin blankets. I was kinda cold.   The absolute worst part, although they warn you about this,  is that they play house music ALL NIGHT LONG from 11pm to 8am. And they warm you it will be loud. I didn't really believe them,  but holy crap. I barely got any sleep, it was so so very loud.   Not a great deal for the amount of money paid. Cheaper and better experience at The Rio.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: wow I just stayed here last night and it was awesome! We were able to get a really great deal from Hotels.com. Since the hotel doesn't have hundreds or thousands of rooms, the check-in and check-out process is pretty fast.   I thought it was cool that each room was decorated with artwork by a particular artist.  The room had a large wide screen plasma with many channels, a ceiling fan and air conditioning, and even a mini-bar.   Everyone working at the hotel seems to enjoy their jobs, even the valet was friendly and extremely prompt.   A couple things I would've preferred would be having the option of self-parking since it was weird asking for the car three or four times in such a short amount of time.. and a brighter light in the restrooms would've been helpful, but the dimness fit in with the rest of the hotel so it was alright.   + different and unique - only valet parking offered

Reviews.Author: earle
Reviews.Content: Adams family / Munsters house meets Vegas. A very unique boutique hotel off the strip. We found the staff friendly with the exception of the restaurant staff. They were almost non existant. Terrible service. The pool was a great place to hang out and listen to the DJ spin.  Happy hour prices are on the high side $6 for a beer. Drinks by the pool are $12. The after hours party starts after 10 and rocks all night into the morning. We woke up to 2 couples screaming and fighting in the hallway on our floor. We called the front dest and they quickly responded and threw the guests out.

Reviews.Author: Natalie
Reviews.Content: Went to a wedding. The food was ok and the drinks were way over priced 5 for a soda and 6 for a bottle of water! Really! 16 for a mixed drink.

Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: So I've stayed here tons before. This was my last stay, however. The place has become shoddy and unkempt, no basic repairs from the last time I've visited. I avoided the pool, but did look at it and it was not cleaned. The bartender told me to sod off when I asked for quarters for a parking meter because he didn't have time, despite the one customer sitting at the bar. The maid twice caused issue with the elevator, once pushing her way in when I was trying to get out on the lobby floor, instead of simply letting me out and then getting in, and another time when she was talking on her cell in the hallway and decided when the doors were closing to push her way in to go to a different floor instead of waiting for the next ride after we'd exited. Valets were all very good, and security was extremely polite, however. The noise from the club was expected, but even on the fifth floor it was thumping through the bed and pillow right into my brain. If you plan on sleeping at night, this is not a place for you. The location is on strip club drive (highland), and you can't really go anywhere without a vehicle. If you call a cab, which you have to do yourself, they won't do it for you, then it can take anywhere from 5-20 minutes to arrive, so plan accordingly. I personally won't be staying here again unless they remodel. I used to enjoy the steak and eggs breakfast, but that wasn't possible with the restaurant closed due to chef personal issues. The restaurant is closed completely except for special events. It's really just a bar and afterhours club with a topless pool that happens to have rooms to stay for when people hook up.

Reviews.Author: Miguel
Reviews.Content: BE WARNED!! My party and I were assaulted by random California natives(according to their license plates), yet we were all somehow also attacked by the Security with tasers and mace. My girlfriend was on the ground, mounted by an overweight woman, and I was on top a man that decided to sucker punch me for trying to calm down the situation. Artisan Security and the Metopolitan are a joke. You're better off beating the shit out of the trouble makers because Security is useless and Metro is too occupied with their Hookers to give a shit about people who actually need valid assistance (especially to the African American officer who was extremely inconsiderate and rude). Thanks to them, we were attacked by crazy people, FOR NO REASON, and they ran away like the cowards they were. Fuck the system!!!

Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay here with my husband for 2 main reasons: the awesome customer service, & the dancing there.   We had just come from a really scary experience trying to check in to another hotel nearby, & we needed something fast. Somehow we stumbled upon this gem in the city & we were so enthralled.  When we got there & explained the odd situation to the receptionist, her empathy was so great. She gave us a great deal on the hotel & gave us a voucher for a free bottle of champagne so we can start out weekend off a little more smoothly. So sweet!   We loved the rooms, they're all so different. The decor all over the hotel is just gorgeous, European style. Just in the lobby it feels like Belle in the library of Beauty & the Beast with a light up fountain in the middle. The ceiling in the bar is filled with gorgeously framed mirrors to open up the room & give a magical touch.   The DJs during the club sessions are phenomenal & dedicated. If this hotel is sold out, go just for the club it is SO FUN! & there's a great out door area to get some air. The pool is fun too, sometimes the hotel puts on fun community events there. Come on locals, this is definitely the place to be on the weekends!!!  One thing about staying in a room on the weekend is you here the music all night if you're trying to sleep, so if you feel like dancing it's great--but it's not really a place to just relax on Friday/Saturday night.   The valet parking is cool too, & I feel like I'm back in Hollywood going to Sur with the pretty strong lights out front.   Surrounding areas, however, are pretty sketchy/not that close to the strip so be prepared to Uber or drive if here. The view of the strip from the rooms are absolutely gorgeous though.   I would definitely come back here. It's like home to me. The only reason why I don't give 5 stars is because not all customer service was like the one receptionist that made us feel at home...some of them are a little apathetic. & I can't guarantee you a good night sleep either. Other than that, what a magical place!!!

Reviews.Author: Marie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Twice at Picasso, and Andy Warhol themed room  I especially enjoyed myself relaxing at Topless pool, Masquerade party,  French-inspired dark decor rooms,  Truly Unique, cozy Hotel!  Nice, kind staff from front desk lady, DJ, bartenders to valet man  You will never find a place like this in Las Vegas! I've stayed many So n so Ordinary 4-5 Star hotels, I find myself more satisfied staying at hotel like this:  Very Affordable yet Full of Character!  You will love here especially, if you are... Young(20's, 30's) or young at heart single or couple, artistic, into great music, art, antique,  old french style, sensuous, avid party goer, jupiter-neptune dreamy type...

Reviews.Author: Lana
Reviews.Content: I am only giving it a star because YOU HAVE TOO!! Yelp needs to change that!!! I do not do reviews because this is someone's livelihood you are possibly destroying and it may just have been an off night. But this one I HAVE TOO!!!!   I soooo wish I would of reviewed this place before going here.   It's located off the side of a highway in the crappiest part of town. I wouldn't even walk to a store there if someone offered me a million dollars to go!!!! You have to valet your car on the premise - yes, that's great but now your obligated to tip the valet every time you want your car. That gets expensive!!!! If you want to park the car yourself you have to park on the street......GOOD LUCK GETTING BACK TO THE HOTEL WITHOUT BEING ROBBED, RAPED, OR WORSE! Entering the lobby, it was darker then dark inside & it took you a minute to figure out where you actually needed to go to check in. Checking in took about 1/2 hr because there was only 1 person behind the counter arguing with a guest. Finally someone comes from who knows where and they help us check in - Takes 5 mins. We take the elevator up to the floor of our room and when we step off the elevator into the hallway I could of been standing in a marijuana field! The smell was sooooo strong & sickly. We go into the room and its hotter then hell inside. Open the window and turn on the A/C. Then find the cologne in my husbands luggage to spray the room down from the stench of the marijuana. The furniture has been repaired a million times from being broken and is now falling apart. The little tiny shelf in the bathroom to put your belongings on is falling off the wall!. The bathroom doesn't look like the tub or shower has been cleaned in years! There is only 2 pillows on the bed so I call down to the front desk to have more pillows and towels sent up to the room. When they arrive they tell me that there is NO MORE PILLOWS IN THE WHOLE HOTEL!  We are suppose to be at the hotel for 3 nights - we go out to enjoy ourselves - upon returning the stench in the hallway again is beyond tolerable. I have never felt so unsafe in my life staying at a hotel. We literally jammed a chair behind the door so that we could go to sleep. Needless to say I did not sleep very much at all. Every sound I heard had my heart pounding.  We where out of that hotel at sunrise!!!!!!!! Spare yourself please!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: This review is strictly based on my experience before even staying there. I had to unexpectedly change the dates of my trip, which starts tomorrow (June 15) and hotels.com would not have been able to do it without cancelling the reservation and booking a new room. I made the original reservation back in November, so the prices one month out were obviously no where near the same. Hotels.com wanted to charge me  MORE for half as many days less than what my original reservation was for in the first place. I panicked a little because this may have meant I would have needed to cancel this trip, which already is something that carried significant meaning to it, but, now more than ever...... I live in Orlando and with the recent events that have occurred this past weekend at a nightclub that I frequent, this trip has taken on an entirely new meaning for me and all of my friends who will be in Vegas and I just wanted to give a huge thank you to Sophia for helping me avert what could have been a serious problem for me. I'm already impressed with the customer service of their staff.  I look forward to my stay with you all.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably cool - went to a wedding there over the weekend - inside looks like a convention of art dealers crashed into a hipster hotel.  Didn't see any of the rooms, but they mix some good drinks in the bar, and the hotel staff were super cool.  I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Nic
Reviews.Content: You have to wonder what some people are thinking by giving this place any more than two or three stars.  The good thing is that this bar is beautiful. The paintings never cease to keep me looking up. I love that. That and the deep leather and just the richness of the place helps to stave away the Vegas look.   The cons are that every person who works here is pretty much rude. A very few aren't, but that's not the majority AT ALL. I get the worst service here. From sitting and waiting and waiting and waiting for a drink, to being told to move out of a section that's reserved for the tweekers and ravers that hit every night. The ones that probably contribute little to the financial success of the bar than say, a professional there for drinks in a quiet, sexy atmosphere. Ahem. Yeah, service is bad.  Next is that they serve the lowest common denominator in alcohol and beer. The choices are so shockingly bad and cheap that I have zero idea how this bar stays afloat. If I want to drink Heineken in a dark place I have a closet in my room and a fridge to store it. Except that Heineken isn't allowed in my fridge so there's that.   This bar has appeal up until you need good service and a good drink then you're better off going to the bars on the strip. No thanks.   Also, this hotel, while also beautiful, is so noisy you will never get sleep. It's so atrocious. Ugh, I have to stop writing about it before I get sick.   Save your money and spend it on something more worthy.

Reviews.Author: carol
Reviews.Content: Finding a great hotel in Vegas that allows pets is NOT easy!! So this is going to be on my frequent flyer radar!!  I loved how dark it was, no one under 21 in hotel!!! (24 hour bar!!) and not attached to Casino made it a really pleasant experience.  Love the party vibe and positive attitudes. The valet and management are truly respectful and appreciative of guests and our needs, especially with dog.  I hope to stay in the room with pool table and mirrors next!!

Reviews.Author: Christopher
Reviews.Content: Great little spot.  Have staycationed here a couple times and always have a blast.  The lounge is very chill until about 10pm when the party starts...and goes on all night long.  Still far from the club feel on the Strip, which makes it even better.    Rooms are tastefully decorated, and the beds are comfortable.  Great job on this one Siegel Group!

Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Prior to last night it had been a few years since I'd been here, glad I came back. It was Saturday night and we got into the lounge around 10 pm. Things were fairly quiet but gradually the music and the crowd got louder and bigger. Glad we got here early to score a table, but you can also get bottle service starting at $200 for a 750ml.   All of the cocktail girls were very friendly and definitely made sure your drinks (at $9 each) never ran out.   The people watching is great, much better crowd than the tweekers at Drai's.   If you haven't been at least show up to marvel at all the eclectic crap everywhere, it sort of akin to living with Alice in Wonderland.   There's a sign near the entrance that says,  Dress code strictly enforced.  Not sure what the code explicitly details but obviously it allows ball caps, bandannas, fedoras, sneakers, T-shirts, and I'm guessing just about anything else you want to wear besides assless chaps.   Next time I won't wait so many years to come back!

Reviews.Author: Kristy
Reviews.Content: The decor is awesome! I loved the art everywhere. The lounge and restaurant were really good too! Those are the reasons I give it 3 stars.  The room was really dusty, the carpet was crunchy and our room was next to the AC unit which was really loud. I would stay there again solely because of the decor and super friendly staff. If they cleaned up a bit, it would be worth 5 stars

Reviews.Author: Sean
Reviews.Content: + Heavy handed drinks + It's like partying in the Haunted Mansion + Best decorated bar in Las Vegas + Cool staff and security + The valet guy rules.  + Very cool and diverse scene

Reviews.Author: Anna
Reviews.Content: This place is worth a try if you're a local or a tourist looking for something different from a cavernous casino. You have to take the weird with the good though. It's not a typical crowd, but that's the cool part if you ask me. The service can be inconsistent. Expect it and chill out! You can hang at the pool without being hustled all day for cash from the staff. If nothing else, go for the art and some great photo ops inside and out! Buy a drink though, it's just the right thing to do. The  out of the way  places need your support to keep Las Vegas from being renamed  MGMMirage, Nevada.

Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: Please reconsider staying here. The place looks interesting online almost unique and strange. The place is dark, dirty, and extremely noisy. I know this is Vegas but this was ridiculous. Besides the loud music that outside, we had drunk people knocking at our door, and you could hear everything from neighboring rooms and I mean everything!

Reviews.Author: Zack
Reviews.Content: This is a review of the Artisan Afterhours Party...  First of all - parking is valet only, so plan ahead and leave yourself $3-$5 for the guy at the end of the night.  Walking into the hotel is simply incredible. They have done an amazing job of decorating the place! While it IS dark inside, there is ample light to enjoy the various painting and mirrors on the walls and ceiling. There are quite a number of beautiful sculptures and vases throughout too.  There isn't a cover to get into the Afterhours party. Just show your ID and you're walking into a thumping techno party with some excellent house beats. The DJs are a lot of fun and the crowd there is very chill with a great appreciation for this type of music.  The alcohol flows generously and the costs are pretty reasonable. I don't remember specific prices, but I haven't ever felt like I was being ripped off.  While the dance floor area is a little small, it's still a lot of fun to groove with the electro beats as the DJ moves the crowd. Even better still is when you're hot and sweaty and want to relax, there are a number of VERY comfortable chairs, couches and love seats to relax on.  Fine leather furniture doesn't seem to match with the house/club music scene, but it really works well at the Artisan. For a little fresh air, try heading out to the patio too.  As far as off-the-strip Afterhours electronic music parties go, this one is as good as it gets.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Yelp Challenge! Started 8/20/2011 (31 of 365). I have a lot of catching up to do!  I like the artsy, dark, historical, and mysterious vibe of this place.  You feel it as soon as you walk in.  It is definitely a boutique hotel and it has that old feeling like you have walked inside something that's been around for a long time.  But there is also a modern kick to the feeling.  I like how you can hang out in the large lobby, in the lounge area near the bar, at the bar, and even outside on their fairly medium sized patio.  There are booths, tables, and heat lamps on the patio where you can hang outside and chat.  The only thing I wish they would do at this place is have a night striclty for Top 40, Hip Hop, and R&B.  The kind of ambiance the environment has would be perfect for a night of good dancing music.  I'm just not into the whole house, trance, and high energy type music all night.

Reviews.Author: Petrice
Reviews.Content: This place... Yea not feeling it!  I can dig the whole grotesque era but Yea this isn't for me. Channel 69 is a porn channel, you have a topless pool. My ceiling fan is about to fall apart. The light bulb broke while the ceiling fan was on and the porter came in with a broom to sweep up the glass -_- Yea me and my friends have booked another room.

Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: There's really nothing quite like the Artisan in Las Vegas.  It's cool without trying.  It's dark and mysterious and best of all . . . it's NOT on the strip!  I generally feel cooler just walking into the place.  The food at Mood is a bit hit or miss but there's no cooler place to sit at the bar and have a drink.  And the bartenders take their jobs seriously.  They mix up really good drinks and are very knowledgable.  Sometime you just feel like something different.  I wish I could comment on the late night atmosphere (which I've been told is awesome), but like the Golden Girls, I go to bed early.

Reviews.Author: Evon
Reviews.Content: Although this place is very cool and Gothic, nice decor, it still has the stench of an old motel. They have done a lot of renovation, but it just has this creepy old feel they just cant shake. I eaten at the restaurant twice, same single waitress in the place, and both times the food was def not worth the price. the restaurant was empty both times we ate there and the service was still bad, go figure? The bread she brought was old and stale and they toasted it lightly to mask the staleness. The food took too long to come out and she never came to check on us after taking the order. They try to be  Ala cart  fine dining so the menu is VERY small and very pricey. The average meal is $20 and up and doesn't come with a salad or anything....over all not worth it. Especially with all the gems in vegas..oh and did i mention you have to valet because theres no parking spaces anywhere?

Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: Not 3 minutes after checking in, the maintenance guy knocked on the door. We opened it and the guy accused us of smoking weed, saying the cleaning ladies had complained about us and warned us of the $250 smoking penalty charge. It ended up being the room next door.  An hour after that, someone opened the door with a card key (none of ours) and tried to walk in only to be held back by the slide bolt I locked on the door. I called downstairs and they said it had been either maintenance or housekeeping (the room was already clean). No apologies, they just said it wouldn't happen again.   What a bunch of shady assholes.   Our room was booked as a double queen. The beds were the double or twin bed width range and as far as length, my feet were hanging out long over the end. I'm 6 ft., barely taller than the average guy, but I felt like Fred Flintstone trying to sleep in a baby crib or something. These were nowhere near queen size, so there's basically an outright lie on the part of the Artisan.   We called three days in advance to request an odd-numbered room (the even numbers face the freeway). Of course, we got an even-numbered room. I guess every single odd room with two beds had already called before us to request theirs, right? Bullshit. They just screwed it up and couldn't admit it.  Management had a very smug, cavalier attitude in responding to our complaints. They didn't bother to offer as much as a comped drink in the lounge or something.   I will say the drinks were strong and the valet was helpful in recommending specific places for going out on the Strip. Everything else about the stay was negative.   I was really looking forward to staying here because of its uniqueness, even knowing that it would be far from the casinos and everything else on the strip. But cool decor and a nice lounge are not worth the downright crappy experience we dealt with on the part of these clowns.   DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. STAY FAR, FAR AWAY FROM THE ARTISAN.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden gem. It's amazing and has so much potential, however it seems like the owner doesn't care enough to make it what it should be. Our bartender renee was awesome she took great care of us was awesome sweet and very knowledgeable. However it wasn't as packed as it once was. Like I said I wish they would put love into this place and bring it back to life. Also for a local spot it's a bit overpriced. The employees are awesome they have love for this place. If you come here definitely ask for renee she's amazing.

Reviews.Author: Mayte
Reviews.Content: I love this spot! It's my favorite hotel in Vegas.  This amazing hotel was carefully conceptualized. Everything from the hallway decor to the bathroom shower head was though out. Even if you are not into art, you can't help but enjoy the atmosphere.   Have never made it to Mood Restaurant or the after hours as I'm always beat by the time I get back to the hotel.   Some reviewers complain about noise - who goes to Vegas to sleep anyway?? I personally haven't had a problem with noise the 2 or 3 times I've stay here.   Cons: Only valet parking (a turn-off for some) and you can't walk right up to the strip, but it's a short drive/cab ride.  I highly recommend staying at The Artisan.

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: If a vampire turned its house it mansion into a hotel, that is what you see when you walk through the door into the Artisan Hotel and Spa.  The place has a lot of charisma and the people there are amazing.  You can carry on a conversation and they will actually have something intelligent to say.  Stay there and join their wine tasting every day.  Get to know the bar tender and enjoy the place.  You can get awesome rates online, so if you like something a little out of the ordinary and for you Vegas is a place to go see shows, the Artisan might just be for you.

Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked in the lobby I felt like I'd stepped in another world of 1940s Paris! Art is everwhere, walls ceilings and tables -- fountains splashing playfully, wonderful! No slots, so quiet! Romantic to say the least. The lounge is large, restuarant sexy and the rooms are so not the norm for this crazy town. I has a B&B feel to it with a punch! Only complaint (seriously the only one) is the air conditioner in the rooms are noisy. No worries if you plan on staying here. Word of warning though, it looks sort of seedy on the outside and you have to travel thru the  gentlemen's club   side of town to get there but it is easy,  just off Saraha. Be prepared to be knocked off your feet when you enter! Valet parking, non smoking in rooms (Lounge and pool area only) and again - no hyped, yelping half drunk people at slots, ringing bells, etc. Just soothing music, dark hide aways, great service and good food! Beds are comfortable, pool area is small and intimate. Perfect for a wedding as they have an incredible chapel that appears just off the boat from Europe! Will definately stay here again! I was on business so the WIFI was nice to have, next time I bring my husband!

Reviews.Author: Kamille
Reviews.Content: The ONLY must-see in Vegas.  This place is truly a slice of heaven to me ... a hidden treasure!  Complete wall to wall, ceiling to floor throughout their amazing lounge areas, secret rooms, chapel (to die for!!!, elevators, hotel halls & rooms, ALL in a very antique/vintage gothic castle decor.  I could live here.  Outdoor party area...you can marry & inexpensive too in the beautiful garden outside. Or indoors at chapel.  -  I am planning my wedding here & I atteneded a friend's brithday here in a suite.  You can't beat the room size, all it includes *pool table / decor / bar & surely not at a comparable rate.  Okay...done daydreaming, now you go enjoy it to!!!! :)

Reviews.Author: Jacob
Reviews.Content: May be clean but that's about it some of the poorest customer service I have ever seen I don't mind paying for customer service and being adult only thought they would be better at it but sadly it is a waste of money I had my belongings gone thru and take out of my room by house keeping.  when I notified the front desk of the situation they said house keeping was closed I would have to call back tomorrow and I said no and then she disconnected the call with me so I called back and down and just asked for a supervisor. They went on to tell me here was nothing they could. Do about it and then wanted to argue the content and value of what was taken out of my room and said that she didn't see the value in it. And she would just notate it on the account but don't look for anything to happen cause the don't do anything about these things. Which didn't make since cause if she was the GM as she so told me she would have the power to just credit my bill $25 dollars but she refused. So that's why she is getting one star with the slacking employees they would grant a 3 star rating but by far not anything more.   It wasn't on the floor next to trash can or anything so it should have never been removed from the room

Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: One of the coolest bar off strip. Gothic and noir theme. Drinks were pretty reasonable.  Pretty good after-hours.  The lobby is awesome, Great for hanging out with your friends.

Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: Well, what can I say, pictures are deceiving.  Although we enjoyed the low rate offered by Groupon, we were less than impressed by the shabby chic and substandard accommodations.  We took into account that we checked in right after the the new years celebrations and that they may be recovering The multiple garbage bags with fluids draining out of them in the hallways, the grime buildup in the rooms and the lack of ventilation in the bathrooms was enough to make us write this review.  The staff was friendly enough except when they called us at 9:50am to tell us the water was to be turned off at 10:00am until 4:00. Their response was well, i just wanted to let you know...  Quick showers for us!  Do  not expect basic accommodations in the room, including coffee.  In fact don't expect coffee in the hotel, period.  We waited for the restaurant/bar to brew one cup of coffee at a time (took about 20 minutes for two cups).  I can say after staying on the strip at a mediocre hotel then coming here,we we felt like we were in the twilight zone. DUMP

Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I guess Frankenstein and Dracula got together to design this place. I had no idea they were still alive...  I must have hit Artisan on the right (or worst) after-hours night, it's however you want to look at it, but this place was epic eclectic. When people say something like that to describe local dive bars or some club, they really have no flipping idea...  Just look at this hit list: 1. A DJ with a cape and fangs. 2. women in expensive formal gowns 3. Hillbilly with beer belly, sandals, and no shirt 4. A sailboat captain 5. Dude wearing  shirt  with only sleeves, no front or back 5. Pimp costume... Goths, Ravers, Emos, Bros, Hipsters, Clubkids, etc. all in the house.. The same house... Yes in short, if you are normal, you aren't not normal. And that's only the people I could describe with mere words... FIVE STARS. The sign in the front said  fashionable attire required  but somehow that meant shoes and shirt were optional. Effin awesome. Vibe was over-the-top friendly. Seriously the strangest and most memorable hotel/nightclub I've ever experienced... Next time, I'll be wearing my Chinaman hat or something... Oh a little hint - Take any picture in this place, and throw some random heavy filter on it, and you will have an amazing picture I promise you. The music was good, the drinks were expensive, valet meh, employees were friendly, bathrooms tiny, blah blah usual stuff... Vampires are real!!!

Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: This review is for the bar and the bar service as well as the Valets.  After living in vegas for 3+ years I received the worst service possible at the bar there.  Sarah Jane's review is right on when she says they OVERCHARGE at the bar.  If it's not an overcharge the prices are ridiculous.  $19 for a small glass of baileys and a beer.  It's hilarious that a place charging these prices doesn't even have decent beer by the bottle (amstel light etc).   Even worse, the chic took forever to come over and take our order (even though the place was near empty).  Then after we order....SHE HAS A 2 MINUTE CONVERSATION WITH ANOTHER EMPLOYEE before completing our order.  Zero class and zero customer service.  It's no wonder the place was near empty at 11pm.  I took a sip of my dates baileys and it was really flat...I could tell the bottle was old.  My date thought it tasted fine so whatever.  For a few bucks more I can take my date to the Mandarin Bar and have a 5* experience with the best possible service.  Why would I return here???  If was funny because the bartender looked over at me as I watched her as she rung in my order.  She included an  upgrade  charge to a single drink charge....the line said  martini upgrade  even though the drink was a small glass of baileys.  The valet scoffed at me when I gave him a $3 tip as we left.  WTF is wrong with these people?????  Whoever owns this place needs to clean house and start over with this bartender, some of the valets, etc.    I also saw the detailed review of the restaurant being closed down not long ago on the news due to health code violations.  I wouldn't eat here if it was free.  I won't be coming back here.  It's a shame because the space is cool and the DJs are good.

Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: Well I guess the reviews already posted say enough. We used to frequent here a few years ago so we knew the drill, but this place has gone way downhill. Valet is still super cool as always but as soon as you get to the door it goes bad, very bad. Security has the mentality of a first grader (probably why he checks I'd, couldn't get a job at McDonalds) get through his little power trip and come to the bar. Few people here, but took forever to get a drink, at strip prices. Looking to get a bottle and table, good luck!  Which leads to the  manager , who I believe would rather have ghetto kids with no money than clients that spend 1-3 grand to enjoy a DJ.  Overall, if you like spending good club prices for a ghetto experience, this is your place. I hate to say that I will never be back, but definitely will never recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Author: Summer
Reviews.Content: TRY TO STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL ! DO NOT STAY HERE. This is the worst hotel I have ever stayed.  They hold Deposit to refund when check out. Today, after 2 weeks it hasn't happened to refund yet then I called the hotel again then she told me to call my bank to release the money back@ what kind hotel is this?????

Reviews.Author: Moria
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to be out of the hustle and bustle of the strip and it was a mistake. Our room was dirty and dingy - the wall paint was chipped all over, there was a hole in the ceiling and the carpet between the bathroom and bedroom was frayed and coming up.  All throughout the hotel bar and lounge, half empty cocktail glasses sat around for hours. At the bar, we sat for 20 min before the bartender even showed up.  The pool area was barren, empty cups and dirty towels all over the day bed and the pool was absolutely filthy. My husband I went out there at night to check it out and three cockroaches were swimming in the water, there were leaves floating all over and both dirt and leaves were stuck at the bottom of the pool. It was so disgusting. A cockroach crawled over my foot while we were seated out there! I've never seen a pool or pool area so dirty. It's really a shame because the idea of a boutique, all adults hotel is great, there just isn't any effort to keep this place nice.  My husband and I changed our flight and left early because we really could not enjoy ourselves here. We'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying that if you are in your early to mid 20s, this is probably the place for you! However, if you are beyond that and looking to relax, stay FAR away!!! We HAD to leave and find a different hotel.   I say this because it is a very small hotel (5 stories) and the hotel is home to a popular after hours club. So from about 2am to 6am, you will not be able to sleep. Our room was on the top floor and it sounded like the club was next door. Our plan was to actually get a good nights sleep so we could have a full Saturday of fun, but that was impossible after staying here.   The hotel is in very close proximity to many strip clubs, and I suspect many patrons were working at said clubs. The smell of pot filled our hallway and my husband and I were stuffy from the smoke. In short, the hotel is in a questionable neighborhood and it is old. This is NOT a new hotel. The pool was also small, cold, and dirty. Do NOT be deceived by the photos of this place!!!  On check in the guy at the front desk did not tell us where anything was and we were left to figure it out. We also had to carry our own luggage. The self parking is a dirt lot across the street from the hotel. Thankfully, they have valet! We booked our room through Hotels.com and complained to them. When they tried to call the front desk-twice- they could not get an answer. We found this to be because the girl was more into texting on her phone than answering the one ringing. Don't expect customer service at this place!

Reviews.Author: Courtney
Reviews.Content: The Artisan Lounge is my preferred place of indulgence in all of Las Vegas. She is superior to all others in her class. She is alluring, romantic, commodious, and very relaxing... I spent hours here nestled into one of her multifold of grand wingback chairs with a drink in one hand and a cigarrette in the other. The handsome artwork, regal mirrors, and elegant sculptures all contribute to her luxurious aristocratic atmosphere. A graceful staff and a savvy bartender preserve this classic and dignified lounge. She will not be kept a secret for long.

Reviews.Author: Myra
Reviews.Content: I have been boycotting the Artisan for over a year since they charged me a  pre-authorization  fee of $40 for using my debit card to buy a few drinks there without notifying me of such, leading to some economic awkwardness in my personal finances.   But this review is for a wedding I attended there this weekend.  There is no question that the decor of the Artisan is legendary.  The theme of the wedding was zombie/fetish so it was the perfect venue.  However, the wedding guests were shocked when the planner approached the bride & groom after the ceremony to try and re-negotiate the contract so they could get more money out of them.  THIS HAPPENED WHILE THE WEDDING WAS IN PROGRESS.  After that disgraceful little scene passed we had the reception during which the dinner portion of the evening was so badly handled that I gave up my place at the table because the food was not being served.  It seems the servers didn't know who was having what so the food was probably sitting around in the kitchen.  Many guests who had the steak option have reported they got ill from it.  My friends threw an awesome wedding in spite of what the Artisan event managers did to try and ruin their special day.  I cannot recommend this venue to anyone who wants to plan a special event.  The staff was completely unprofessional and trying to change the contract DURING the event  was just vicious and heartless.  The boycott continues.

Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Artsy fartsy. We stayed here for our cousin's wedding. I like places like this! Art all over the place. Sometimes, it even felt haunted at times and that the eyes in some of the paintings were following me.   I loved the ambience of this place. No gambling here, so it felt like we weren't even in Vegas, but a small boutique hotel in LA or SF rather.  Our room was A-ok. First room we checked into was dirty. Used washcloth on our bed and toilet paper on the floor. Disgusted, I requested for a new room immediately. I was hoping to get upgraded to a bigger room for the inconvenience but that didn't happen. We changed to a similar room, but it was cleaner nonetheless. Dust on the remote control and clogged up bathtub were my only complaints.   Our cousins, however stayed in one of the penthouse suites. Pretty sweet I must say. Same suite the Kardashiens stay at when they're in Vegas.   I will not be staying here again, but it was a cool experience.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: I am with Lindsay A. on this one.  I am very mixed.   We stayed on a Sunday night which entailed the After Hours party.  While we did not actually attend it, we could hear it until 9am when it finally stopped.  It did not affect our sleeping and it proved entertaining.   Their website is a joke when it comes to the lighting of this place.  In fact, pictures cannot even capture the lighting because, well, there really isn't any.  The walls are very dark, if not black, and complimented by very dim lighting, mirrors on ceilings and walls, and huge art decor EVERYWHERE.  It really does feel, and look, like Disney's  Haunted Mansion  but with a dash of  what sort of crazy S&M place is this?   It is a *VALET ONLY* hotel but they do have a  Self Park  lot across the street.  We used both services; valet when we first arrived and self-park when we returned from our night out.  I have no quarrels with either one.  The self park seemed slightly sketchy but we woke up and the car was still there - YAY!  I was highly disturbed by the gigantic nun painting in our room because it was hung right next to the bed and it's never good to be watched by a nun while in bed.  She was clearly a perverted, creepy nun to be hovering next to our bed like that.   Overall, I would probably stay here again since I know what to expect from this hotel of terror.   I will also ask for extra sheets to hang over the insanely large and creepy paintings in my bedroom. (:

Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: I recently hit up the Sunday pool party which had a $5 cover, but was cash only. Fortunately there was an ATM nearby, and the fees doubled the entry charge. Once inside the pool area, I found that the drinking fountain had been removed since my last visit. The bartender literally tried to ignore me when I asked for a water, and then told me he was supposed to charge me $6 for it when I insisted that is what I wanted!? The pool water was clear, but the pool was full of dirt and pine needles. Decent bass from the Dj's and some cool people to hang out with, but doesn't make up for the inconveniences and poor quality of service.

Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY at this place unless you want to be charged with fraudulent damage and smoke fees. My brother recently had his birthday party here at the masterpiece suite and was charged 400$ in fees for the room being a mess and them accusing people of smoking in the room. Absolutely no one smoked in this room as i was there all night and was a witness, and isn't it the maids job to clean a room with boxes and beer bottles left in it? I'm amazed at the shady practices of this place,  and would highly recommend you stay away! I used to frequent this establishment, but will never go back due to this.

Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: The guy at the front desk was courteous; only reason why this place gets 2 stars instead of 1 -dark and shady on the inside. I guess some like that feel. I thought it was creepy. -parking sucks unless you want to do valet -loud music -sketchy part of Vegas -far from the strip -asked for more blankets/pillows. Got a couple sheets and was told there were more pillows in the closet. There weren't. Asked for more pillows. I was told the room only comes with two. -just spend an extra couple of bucks and just find something on the strip

Reviews.Author: Violet
Reviews.Content: My bf and I booked this hotel the day of during a 2 week road trip. I chose it  because of the great Yelp reviews and the cheap rate from hotels.com ($54). Our stay was not quite as bad as 2 stars, but yet not quite 3.    We arrived around 9pm on our way home to Cali and the place smelled sort of like mold. First of all, the place is right next to the highway and with our discount rate, I just knew we'd get a noisy room. We were forwarned about the mandatory valet parking because of Yelp ($11.50 - lame) but not of the 'resort fee' ($3.50 - lamer). But whatever - the room was a decent price so we didn't complain. However, we had to wait almost an hour at the desk because the people before us had some problem with their room. When we got to our room, all that I really wanted to do was to take a shower, but there were no towels. I called down to the front desk and they assured us they'd be sent up. 1 hour later, no towels. Another call made. 30 minutes, no towels until the bf went down to the desk and came back with what looked and smelled like pool towels.   Forgiving that, the room was comfortable and very chic-ly decorated - and there is free WiFi. But the paintings all over the walls were a tad creepy, especially with a painting of 2 children facing our bed. I do give them kudos for the interesting concept and decor - but I probably wouldn't stay here again, because it's distance from the strip and the parking situation.

Reviews.Author: Dani
Reviews.Content: The Grapefruit Martini was good, the atmosphere was unique.  A friend who use to live in Vegas brought me here, because she wanted to feel like a local again.  I am not sure if I would go out of my way to check this place out, but if you are looking for a great place a little off the strip, you should check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Briget
Reviews.Content: After hours was kind of a bust. Weak crowd, but bottle service remedied the situation that we were in. Our waitress wasn't that great, we were all sharing cups because she only brought a few. Didn't really like the music at all.

Reviews.Author: Crystal
Reviews.Content: One of these days I'm going to rent a room here for the night! This place is so COOL! The lobby has this ambiance of an old spooky, dark, eclectic, art filled hotel, like La Louvre meets the Bates Motel. I love coming here- they have a bar, lounge, dance floor, pool, patio, lobby, plenty of places to sit- Its great! Drinks range from average to pricey- so if your looking for cheap you're not going to find it here- BUT normally on a Friday or Saturday night that have a Dj and the music changes from Techno, to R&B, Hip-Hop, and Old-school. What I like the most about this place is the crowd- which is never the same- there's always a mix of young, old, odd, tall, and short :b To me, this is the type of place you want to come with a crowd of friends or maybe if you have a date and want to impress the person you're with ;)   They have a door man and bouncers but I do not believe there is a cover, at least there is never a cover when me and my friends go, unless there is an event going on... and most out of towners stay at the hotel....

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: This review is just for the BAR I didn't stay at hotel This I feel is the coolest non-cool place I've ever been to. It's hip, non pretentious and no one knows about it. If you have cool Friends already and want to get away from the big club, doormen in tux's, bottle service sht, then this is the place for you. You bring your own party. Although I did meet cool people while I was there. It's not meat markety.  The bartenders are attentive and pour strong drinks. Also props to the valet,  we couldn't get a cab, so he drove us himself to out next destination...hello  RHINO!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I've not stayed in the hotel so this is solely a review for the club.  I love the Artisan...once you get in the door there is an energy and an underground vibe that hits you because of the awesome, dark decor and the pulsing techno or house. The resident DJs also DJ various other clubs on the strip during the day or night and I think they really let loose with more experimental tunes and more flavor at Artisan because its after-hours and it's unpretentious and there's no cover, no VIP guest barking orders on what music he wants the DJ to be playing. As a local, I rarely EVER go to a club on the strip because all you find is pretentiousness and VIP big dogs like ultra rich and celebrities who want the house DJ to play  Livin' on a Prayer  and have been known to get well known house DJs KICKED OFF THE DECKS because they have such pull because of their money. So as far as music is concerned and club experience, Artisan is where it's at for me in Las Vegas. Minor updates could be applied like making an alternate walkway to the bathrooms (if possible) instead of directly through the dancefloor. I'm usually too wasted to concentrate on little inconveniences like that so that doesn't factor into why I gave 4 stars instead of 5.  The reason I gave 4 stars instead of 5 is because they are still employing some god-awful bouncers. I'm not sure where they get these people, especially the bald white guy with the attitude, but hassling people and giving them attitude is inexcusable when more than any other club I know of in Vegas, the people attending are just looking to have a good time. There are very few meatheads, no rabble rousers. Lighten the hell up!  I'm a security professional by trade. When I say security professional, I mean I was a bodyguard for Senators and a certain President in Iraq and in Afghanistan. I have 108 armed employees under my control currently. Securing an entrance and being a doorman does not require an attitude. In fact, it can escalate problems or cause them where there are none. People are coming in to spend money and create profit for the Artisan, why adversely affect their experience and cause them to not come back? I think the management at Artisan needs to seriously take a look at the people they hire out there. A smile and a common courtesy as opposed to a glare and snarl goes a long way when someone's first impression is the doorman.   Just some helpful advice from someone near the top of the professional security food chain;)  I hope to see you all for my birthday when I get back from Afghanistan!  Take care,  Jake

Reviews.Author: K
Reviews.Content: Serious lack of sleep makes for a GRUMPY!!!!!! This place is right under a highway bridge and it sounds like it. The sirens going off and the horns being pissy will wake you up thru out the night. The door has a gap at the bottom and the shower is tiny and dark. The bathroom is done in a cool black theme but there is one small light. It's like the place was built to be the center of a dark smutty porn because the room is pretty dark too (with 3 lamps). Unless you turn on the main lamp. Then you are looking at the sun in your room. Not worth the stay. One plus side is the deco in the halls and lobby is awesome. I would say just come and see the lounge and bar.

Reviews.Author: Katie
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE! What a complete disappointment. I was so excited to stay at this hotel, heard it was super dark and really fun. Got there, checked in everything seemed fine. They charged me $125 deposit to my card ($25 non refundable for our dog). Sweet no big deal. Get up to the room, loved it super cool. We'll have fun with the shower, water pressures terrible and you'll either burn your skin off or freeze. Your pick. Then water won't drain. Whatever, minor things. At least we got a shower.. So we stayed a night and checked out the next day. The woman who checked me out gave me a receipt for a $25 refund of the pet deposit then informed me my deposit would be refunded in 25 days.
